item.title: Reports: FBI Investigating Countrywide
item.description: The FBI is in the early stages of an inquiry into whether company officials misrepresented its financial position and the quality of its mortgage loans, The Wall Street Journal first reported Saturday, citing law enforcement officials and finance executives with knowledge of the development.

item.title: Glass Stairs
item.description: What a cool idea!

item.title: A Loyal Clinton Soldier Turns in His Badge
item.description: She has no idea how many times I defended her. For sixteen years, I was a proud soldier in the legion of "Clinton apologists" -- who believed that peace and prosperity were more important than regrettable personality traits. And then she ran for president.

item.title: How Webmasters Get Exercise
The History of Tux, the Linux Penguin
item.description: The History and Evolution of Tux, the Linux Mascot

item.title: Super Smash Bros. errors may be more than they seem
item.description: After last months issue with "Dirty disc" problems in Japan, it may be no surprise that the same issues are popping up in the U.S. Nintendo has a remedy and plans to "Clean" every defective Wii. The problem? It's a lie. But a lie that may be good for gamers in the long run.

item.title: Newsweek: 64% of Israelis Want Talks With Hamas NOW
item.description: In Israel a growing chorus of security officials, academics and regular Israelis have begun calling for negotiations with Hamas, in spite of escalating violence. Why then do all purported Israelis and pro-Israel diggers portray their anti-Hamas, pro-war position as "correct" and mainstream?

item.title: Women in jeans 'cannot be raped'
item.description: The Supreme Court of Appeal in Rome on Wednesday overturned a rape conviction, saying that the supposed victim must have agreed to sex because her jeans could not have been removed without her consent.

item.title: Politico: Photo of Clinton "negotiating borders in Kosovo"
item.description: .... with Sheryl Crow and Sinbad! :) Clinton claim: "I negotiated open borders to let fleeing refugees into safety from Kosovo."Chicago Tribune: Borders opened before she got there; she stayed for a day with Sheryl Crow, Sinbad, and her daughter.

item.title: Will Thomas: Clinton Got Money From Rezko Codefendants
item.description: Clinton and Republicans got money from the soon to be tried defendants! Obama got ZILCH (and even his opponents got money).Somebody running for President has INTEGRITY!!!

item.title: Stop Saying Americans Are “Smarter Than That" - Bill Maher
item.description: [ VIDEO] ”New rule, politicians must stop saying “the American people are smarter than that.” No they aren’t! If the Bush era has taught us anything, it’s that voters want a president carved in their own image. Someone who doesn’t like to read or believe anything he’s told and is easily distracted by bright, shiny objects.”

item.title: Anonymize BitTorrent Transfers with BTGuard
item.description: BTGuard is an easy to use proxy service that adds an extra layer of privacy to your BitTorrent transfers. The service is designed for BitTorrent users who don’t want their ISPs or any third party to log or throttle their IPs or traffic.

item.title: AP Probe Finds Drugs in Drinking Water
item.description: A vast array of pharmaceuticals (AP) -- including antibiotics, anti-convulsants, mood stabilizers and sex hormones - have been found in the drinking water supplies of at least 41 million Americans, an Associated Press investigation shows.

item.title: Democrat grabs Hastert’s House seat
item.description: Democrat Bill Foster has snatched former House Speaker Dennis Hastert's congressional seat in a closely watched special election that gave the longtime Republican district to the Democrats. Sweet!

item.title: Trailer Tracking: The Best & Worst in Recent Movie Trailers
item.description: We thought we’d take a look at some recent coming attractions and rundown what we’re excited about, what underwhelmed us, and what we’re planning to avoid - based on these little tightly-edited care packages of carefully-choreographed cinema. Trailers in this edition include Iron Man, X-Files 2, Pineapple Express, and Indy 4.

item.title: Why is switching XP for Vista an “upgrade”?
item.description: They Criticized Vista. And They Should Know.Microsoft says high prices have been the deterrent. Last month, the company trimmed prices on retail packages of Vista, trying to entice consumers to overcome their reluctance.

item.title: Who Do You Think You Are? (PIC)
item.description: Look closer....Creepy ad!

item.title: Linix is Beautiful: KDE 4.1: Visual Changelog (rev 783000)
item.description: You don’t always see this in the official changelogs but the KDE 4 development is progressing in an extraordinary speed. After a deep look at rev 777000 we are presenting you a new visual review of changes made to KDE 4 during the last couple of weeks.

item.title: Extremely Impressive Shiny Balls [PICS]
item.description: The enormous 34ft diameter shiny ball pictured above goes by the name of ‘la géode’. this stunning metallic structure houses a 1000m² hemispheric imax screen at the ‘cité des sciences et de l’industrie’ in paris. it was designed in 1983 by french architect adrien fainsilber and then realised by engineer gérard chamaillou.

item.title: KBR water makes US troops in Iraq sick
item.description: Dozens of U.S. troops in Iraq fell sick at bases using "unmonitored and potentially unsafe" water supplied by the military and a contractor once owned by Vice President Dick Cheney's former company, the Pentagon's internal watchdog says.

item.title: Nintendo Offers to Repair Broken Super Smash Bros Brawls
item.description: Nintendo of America already has a site up dedicated to repairing Wii that won't play SSBB.

item.title: we are moving!!!
item.description: right now we are moving at 600 Kilometers per second! aint that amazing?

item.title: Pure Pwnage Episode 16 - Duty Calls is Out!!!
item.description: Finally after months of waiting another episode has been released.

item.title: Ted Haggard Tells Richard Dawkins He is "Arrogant"
item.description: After implying that science is wrong and he is right, Haggard tells Dawkins that "I don't communicate an air of superiority."

item.title: Great gadget ruined by form factor
item.description: Asus, the Taiwanese company that makes the popular Asus Eee PC, has come up with an absolutely wonderful idea ruined by its form factor. The idea is to combine portable wireless mouse with flash storage. Designers chose -- inexplicably -- to make the device shaped not like a mouse, but like a memory stick.

item.title: How This Economy Is Going To Play Out
item.description: 15 preditions for the future..none of it good.

item.title: Track Price Drops at any Site with Price!pinx
item.description: Ever wanted to know when the price on an item drops? Price!pinx offers a price-watching service that doesn't require searching or limit itself only to Amazon, eBay, or any other big-name site. Just highlight the price on any site and use their bookmarklet & you'll get an email alert when the price goes down. Direct link http://pricepinx.com

item.title: You better run, punk.
item.description: Heavy using mah sentry!

item.title: Iraq Veterans Against the War: Winter Soldier (March 13-16)
item.description: The four-day event will bring together veterans from across the country to testify about their experiences in Iraq and Afghanistan - and present video and photographic evidence. In addition, there will be panels of scholars, veterans, journalists, and other specialists to give context to the testimony.

item.title: The BitTorrent Legend Returns: I Am aXXo
item.description: During November last year we reported that the popular DVD ripper aXXo had decided to take a break and stop releasing new material for a while. It now seems that he is back in business. A few hours ago aXXo uploaded his first movie in months. He chose “I Am Legend”.

item.title: Foxtrot celebrates the release of Smash Bros Brawl!
item.description: The hilarious comic strip Foxtrot has released a comic about Smash Bros Brawl to celebrate it's launch in North America. Have you picked up the Brawl yet? If not, what are you waiting for!

item.title: A Complete Timeline of the Futurama Universe
item.description: I've seen a bundle of Futurama timelines around the place and I found them all to be inadequate, because they don't, by a long shot, include every conceivable dated event from the show. So I went through, watched the whole 72-episode run again - yes, this is entirely my own work - my considerably more exhaustive Futurama timeline.

item.title: Amazon: What are you hiding?
item.description: Amazon shipped its Kindle e-Book reader way back in November of last year -- since then, the company has tried to paint a picture of runaway success by suggesting that the incredible popularity of the device prevents the company from keeping up with orders. Is the Amazon the Kindle really a secret failure?

item.title: Darkslide Trick...Don't Try This At Home!
item.description: Awesome trick!

item.title: Revealed at last: Scotland Yard's Jack the Ripper case book
item.description: Numerous documents relating to the Victorian killer which, after more than a century in the archives, are to go on public display for the first time, includinghandwritten accounts from the scenes of the crimes, detectives' case reports, coroners' inquiry records, witness statements, photographs and letters.

item.title: FOXNews Lists Why Spying on 300 Million People is Worth It
item.description: Here from the Ministry of Propaganda is a list of those malevolent "plots" that necessitated the erection of the current warrentless spy state in which we now live, and why we should be all be grateful for the shredding of the Constitution, gutting of the treasury, and the endless warcrime of Iraq. Digg it!

item.title: Inside Beijing's shocking death camp for cats
item.description: Thousands of pet cats in Beijing are being abandoned by their owners and sent to die in secretive government pounds as China mounts an aggressive drive to clean up the capital in preparation for the Olympic Games.

item.title: Train Hillary Has Jumped the Tracks
item.description: In 2 days since she endorsed McCain over Obama, who's qualifications she derided, leading Left pundits let her HAVE it: Olberman, Huffington, Richard Wolf and Dana Millbank, Randi Rhodes, Ed Schultz, Rachael Maddow, Thom Hartmann, Stephanie Miller... And no prominent pundit or Democratic Party leader has dared defend Hillary's loathsome remarks.

item.title: 10 Worst Countries for Women
item.description: Today March 8 is International Women's Day. In spite of real progress around the globe, the bedrock problems that have dogged women for centuries remain.

item.title: Dude with weirdest hair I've ever seen busted for pet abuse!
item.description: Is it hair? Is it a wig? Hell, I have no idea but this is one sick puppy!
